column2: injuries but more indelibly leaves a scar on the most cherished possession of a
woman ie.  her dignity,  honour;  reputation and not the least her chastity.  Rape
is not only a crime against the person of a woman it is a crime against the entire

column1: society.  It destroys,  as noted by this Court in Shri Bodhisattwa Gautam  v.  Miss

column2: Subhra Chakraborty (AIR  1996 SC 922),  the entire psychology of a woman and

column1: pushes her into deep emotional crisis.  It is a crime against basic human rights
and is also  violative of the  victim's most cherished of the Fundamental Rights,

column2: the Right to  Life  contained in  Article 21  of the  Constitution  of India,
